classifier

Class graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • classifier.graph

  • public class graph
extends java.lang.Object
    The graph class has the purpose of creating a graph to be used by the classifier. It contains all the methods needed to use Prim's algorithm, get values from the graph and print it. A graph object encapsulates the information about the structure of the graph.

    • Field Summary

      Class node (C).
      private java.util.ArrayList<connection> DAG
      List of connections that represents the graph used by the classifier

      • _class_node

        private NodeC _class_node
        Class node (C). This node is different from the others in the graph which are related to the features (X1, ..., Xn).

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create(alpha[][] matrix)
        Creates a graph using Prim's Algorithm
        Parameters:
        matrix - matrix containing all the alphas which represent the weight of each connection Edges.matrix

      • getNextNode

        private connection getNextNode(boolean[] visited,
                               alpha[][] matrix)
        The getNextNode method is the core of the implemented Prim's Algorithm It calculates the next node to be included in the graph
        Parameters:
        visited - List of all nodes already in the graph create(alpha[][])
        matrix - matriz of alphas containing all the connections between nodes Edges.matrix
        Returns:
        the next connection to be included in the graph connection

      • updateVisited

        private boolean[] updateVisited(int index,
                                boolean[] visited)
        Method called after a new node is inserted in the graph to update the list of the visited nodes
        Parameters:
        index - index in the visited array to be updated
        visited - List of all nodes already in the graph create(alpha[][])
        Returns:
        updated visited array

      • checkVisited

        private int checkVisited(boolean[] visited)
        Checks if all nodes are in the graph
        Parameters:
        visited - List of all nodes already in the graph create(alpha[][])
        Returns:
        1 if all nodes are inserted, 0 if not

      • getRootNode

        private java.util.ArrayList<connection> getRootNode(alpha[][] matrix)
        Gets the graph's root node and the first son node
        Parameters:
        matrix - matrix containing all the alphas Edges.matrix
        Returns:
        array list containing the root node the first son node connection
